name: Atlach-Nacha, the Spider God
appearance: A colossal, otherworldly spider entity with innumerable long legs and a massive abdomen, constantly weaving immense cosmic webs that span between worlds.
background: Atlach-Nacha is an ancient spider god dwelling in the Dreamlands, endlessly weaving a titanic web intended to connect its realm to the waking world. Through cults, spider-creatures, and hidden sanctuaries, its influence seeps into human reality.
goals: Complete the great web linking the Dreamlands and the waking world
Expand its influence through cultists, spider-creatures, and corrupted humans
notes:
Average Damage Bonus: +2D6.
Combat Behavior: Atlach-Nacha attacks by kicking with its many legs or slamming enemies with its massive abdomen. Attacks per round: 1.
Combat – Bite: The bite pierces any normal armor and injects a paralytic toxin. The target must succeed at an Extreme CON roll to resist paralysis for 1D10 rounds, then make a second CON roll. If both rolls succeed, the toxin is resisted; if both fail, the target is paralyzed.
Combat Maneuver – Web Projection: Targets are wrapped in strong, sticky webs. Escaping requires an opposed STR test against STR 150.
Armor: 12-point chitin and fur. When reduced to 0 HP, Atlach-Nacha escapes through complex web-tunnels to a secret lair to recover.
Spells: All Contact (Call/Contact) spells.
Skills Detail: Fighting 60% (30/12), damage bonus or bite; Web Projection 80% (40/16).
Sanity Loss: Seeing Atlach-Nacha causes 1/1D10 SAN loss.

properties.note: Mythos entity; document section focuses on stats/combat/spells rather than loot/inventory.
